text: (upbeat music plays)
♪ Hey ♪
(upbeat music plays)
(upbeat music continues)
(relaxed music plays)
(Dev speaking foreign language)

- Harsh Sarohi, the
senior VP of technology
at Tradeindia.com.

So Harsh, it'll be great if
you can start by telling us

about the purpose and
vision of Tradeindia.com.

Thank you, Dev. It's
a pleasure to be here.
So, we started in 1996.

At that point of time,
only 0.1% of the population
had access to the internet.
Yet there were 3 million SMEs and MSME

facing challenges in terms
of reaching potential buyers.

We, as Tradeindia, wanted
to bridge this gap,
and we launched a digital platform
where they could register themselves,

and showcase their product
to the potential buyers.
Out of 63 million SMEs and MSMEs today,
we have 10 million registered with us,
and they are dealing 90,000 categories.

And daily, we have been doing
thousands of trade connections
between the buyers and sellers.

- That's fantastic. 10
million registered buyers

out of the 63 million,
and that's really great.
You touched upon an interesting point,
you mentioned about economic value.

It'll be great if you can
tell us a little example about

how Tradeindia.com is
creating economic value.

- One of our early clients
for the manufacturer,
handicraft manufacturer,

in a very small city in
India, called Moradabad.

Although he used to manufacture
exquisite brassware,

but he lacked reach
beyond the local market.

Within months of
registering on our platform,

he started receiving inquiries
from all over the world,

not just India, and his
revenue almost tripled.
So this example is an epitome of the gap
that we intend to fill.
- That's a really great example, Harsh,

of how you've actually
created an increase in revenue
and adding jobs into the economy.
So, can you tell us a little bit more

about your digital journey
in technology adoption?
- So we started as an online directory,
with very basic search functionality,

where a buyer would come and
search for a seller directly.
Then we started reading email inquiries.
Gradually we moved to SMS, WhatsApp.

We also launched independent
catalog websites.

We launched a platform
called GetDistributors.
So with all these,

we had massive amount of
traffic and data flowing
into our system,

but this also presented us
with the certain challenges
in terms of scalability and security.
So we transitioned to microservices.

We broke down our entire
monolithic architecture.
With microservices, we got the agility
in terms of development.

Also security, and security
was good with microservices.
So Tradeindia, the digital journey is one

of constant evolution and
adaptation to customer needs.
- Thanks for the details, Harsh.
As you were talking about microservices,
and how that's helped you to scale,

it actually brings me to
the amazon.com journey,
our e-commerce business,
where we had to do something similar.

Look at microservices, API
enable our core services

so we could get into multiple
categories and products.

So it'll be great if you can
tell us a little bit more about

at what point did you decide
to get into AWS cloud,

and the kind of business
benefit that you've had?

- We were facing scalability
and security challenges.

So we started considering
AWS like a year ago.

We started by integrating
Content Delivery Network.
CDN helps in securing API endpoints,

and also caches pages on
different Edge locations
that AWS has.

So, when a person wants to
access a particular webpage,

so it gets triggered
from the nearest location
on which it is cached.
So when we integrated it on our website,

we saw a reduction in
page load time by 30%.
Our customer experience also improved.

Then we deployed our
microservices on AWS cloud.
We started using Kubernetes on AWS,

and made AWS our partner in
the app modernization journey.
With monolith architecture,
we were running completely on the VMs.

Kubernetes, it allows us
to run less number of VMs.

The entire cluster is
deployed on these VMs.
And with Kubernetes,

we got a fine gain control
on the CPU and memory.

So our infra spend also
came down by 30%, roughly.
We are using AI heavily,

and we are also working
on an AI algorithm,

where we could match potential
buyer with potential sellers.

AWS, I would say has
helped us so dramatically
in terms of innovation and growth.

- Thank you so much,
Harsh, for being here.
I think your story is a fantastic example

of what technology can do to
really transform the economy.
So once again, thank you.

And to our audience, thank
you for joining us. And-
(Dev speaking foreign language)

on the next episode of
"Business Builders".
(upbeat music plays)
